key_talking_points: P1 incident root cause analysis indicates lateral movement from compromised service account — Azure AD Conditional Access and PIM would have prevented escalation
Microsoft Sentinel SIEM with healthcare-specific detection rules identifies 85% more threats than Lamna's current SIEM, with 60% fewer false positives
Zero Trust architecture with Microsoft Entra ID, Defender for Cloud, and Intune provides end-to-end protection across Lamna's 12,000 endpoints and 400 applications
HIPAA Security Rule compliance dashboard in Defender for Cloud provides continuous compliance monitoring — reducing audit preparation from 6 weeks to 3 days

customer_references.summary: Zero Trust deployment after security incident. 90% reduction in lateral movement risk. HIPAA audit passed with zero findings. Sentinel detects threats 4x faster than previous SIEM.
Microsoft Sentinel + Defender for Cloud across 40 hospitals. 75% reduction in mean time to detect (MTTD). $4.2M annual savings from SIEM consolidation.

sales_plays.summary: Deploy Microsoft Fabric with HIPAA BAA coverage as the unified analytics platform for clinical outcomes, population health, and operational efficiency — replacing Lamna's fragmented analytics tools with a governed, compliant data estate.
key_talking_points: Fabric with HIPAA BAA and PHI data governance enables Lamna to analyze clinical data at scale without building custom de-identification pipelines — saving 6 months of development
FHIR-native data ingestion connects Epic and Cerner EHR data directly to Fabric — eliminating the HL7 middleware that costs $1.2M/year to maintain
Population health analytics on Fabric identify high-risk patient cohorts 30 days earlier than current methods, improving preventive care interventions by 25%
Real-time operational dashboards reduce OR turnaround time by 18% and bed management cycle time by 22% — estimated $8.5M annual operational savings

customer_references.summary: Fabric for clinical and operational analytics. FHIR integration with Epic. Population health models improved chronic disease management outcomes by 20%. Full HIPAA compliance.

resources.title: Fabric for Healthcare — HIPAA Compliance Guide

sales_plays.play_name: Copilot for Healthcare with Compliance Controls
sales_plays.summary: Deploy M365 Copilot with healthcare-specific compliance controls (PHI sensitivity labels, HIPAA-grade DLP, and audit logging) for Lamna's 3,500 administrative and clinical support staff.
key_talking_points: Copilot with Microsoft Purview sensitivity labels automatically detects and protects PHI in AI-generated content — meeting HIPAA minimum necessary standard
Clinical documentation specialists using Copilot generate discharge summaries and referral letters 45% faster — reducing documentation backlog by 60%
Healthcare compliance team automates policy review and regulatory correspondence with Copilot — reducing compliance workload by 35%
DAX Copilot integration for clinical note generation reduces physician documentation time by 50% — addressing Lamna's #1 physician burnout driver

customer_references.summary: Copilot for 8,000 administrative staff with HIPAA controls. 42% productivity improvement. Zero PHI incidents in 12 months. Physician satisfaction up 18 points with DAX Copilot.

resources.title: Copilot for Healthcare — HIPAA Compliance Playbook

microsoft_strengths: Microsoft's security stack (Sentinel, Defender, Entra) is the most integrated in the industry — critical given the active P1 incident
Fabric's FHIR-native integration with Epic and Cerner is uniquely differentiated — AWS HealthLake requires significantly more custom development
DAX Copilot for clinical documentation is a healthcare-exclusive AI capability with no direct AWS or Google equivalent
risks: AWS HealthLake and Amazon Comprehend Medical are gaining traction with clinical NLP use cases
Epic's expanding analytics capabilities (Caboodle, Cosmos) could reduce demand for external analytics platforms like Fabric
